reviews.title: The Smashing Pumpkins - Siamese Dream
reviews.description: A true classic. One of the best albums ever made. Billy Corgan learned all the tricks of making a great album, but still hasn't been spoiled by success.

reviews.title: Remo Drive - Greatest Hits
reviews.description: Generic emo-punk album of the year 2017.

reviews.title: *shels - Plains of the Purple Buffalo
reviews.description: Emotional rollercoaster. Great use of trumpets in an otherwise shoegazy post-rock-ish setting.

reviews.title: The Smashing Pumpkins - Gish
reviews.description: Billy Corgan's classic rock influences are most noticable on this album. It's something like 70s classic rock meets grunge in Chicago.

reviews.title: The Smashing Pumpkins - Mellon Collie and The Infinte Sadness
reviews.description: Probably the worst album of the Smashing Pumpkins recognized trilogy. Has the most girth but lacks the emotional honesty that Gish and Siamese Dream have.

reviews.title: American Football - American Football LP1
reviews.description: Masterfully captures the american midwestern vibe.

reviews.title: Blink-182 - Cheshire Cat
reviews.description: This album makes all the difference between Blink-182 and all the bands that try to be Blink-182 and that's melody on top of the generic american punk chords.

reviews.title: American Football - American Football LP2
reviews.description: At first I thought that it tries to perfectly match the LP1, but it gets better with every subsequent listen. I predict in 10 years time this album will be as classic as the LP1.

reviews.title: Payday 2
reviews.description: Multiplayer is okay, singleplayer feels like a boring late 90s FPS. The visuals are not that great. There is nothing distinctive in the graphics by itslef. The texture quallity is really shitty for a 2013 game even when maxed out. The AI is simple and predictable and doesn't react well when the player is really close. The sound and music quality are adequate.
